metadata.Title: CVE-2022-23124 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description: [Netatalk get_finderinfo Out-Of-Bounds Read Information Disclosure Vulnerability This vulnerability allows remote attackers to disclose sensitive information on affected installations of Netatalk. Authentication is not required to exploit this vulnerability. The specific flaw exists within the get_finderinfo method. The issue results from the lack of proper validation of user-supplied data, which can result in a read past the end of an allocated buffer. An attacker can leverage this in conjunction with other vulnerabilities to execute arbitrary code in the context of root.]

notes.Note: 0xnishit> Fix commit: https://github.com/Netatalk/Netatalk/commit/4a8f6c964d5ca86df27c50e50dc1b60d39c9b76d Backporting MR is yet to generate

criterions.comment: netatalk package in impish is affected and needs fixing.
